intro: Diplycosia supyanii, commonly known as the Bornean mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Viscaceae family and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as Dipterocarps. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its berries are usually red or yellow, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
